quizDescription: Test your knowledge of web development concepts and technologies with this medium-level quiz!
quizTags: Web Development, Frontend, Backend, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Frameworks

questions.question: Which language is used for defining the structure of a web page?
questions.explanation: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is used for defining the structure and content of a web page.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to define the presentation and layout of HTML documents.

questions.question: Which programming language is often referred to as the 'language of the web'?
questions.explanation: JavaScript is often referred to as the 'language of the web' because it is widely used for creating interactive and dynamic web pages.

questions.question: What does the 'D' stand for in 'DOM' in web development?
questions.explanation: DOM stands for Document Object Model, which represents the structure of an HTML or XML document as objects that can be manipulated with programming languages like JavaScript.

questions.question: Which tag is used to link an external CSS file to an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The 'link' tag is used to link an external CSS file to an HTML document, allowing the styles to be applied to the web page.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in the 'img' tag?
options: To add alternative text for accessibility
To apply a CSS style to the image
questions.answer: To add alternative text for accessibility
questions.explanation: The 'alt' attribute in the 'img' tag is used to provide alternative text for the image, which is displayed if the image fails to load or for accessibility purposes.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create space between the content and the border of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'padding' property is used to create space between the content and the border of an element in CSS.

questions.question: Which method is commonly used to make asynchronous HTTP requests in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'fetch' method is commonly used to make asynchronous HTTP requests in JavaScript to interact with APIs and retrieve data.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to create a horizontal line that separates content?
questions.explanation: The 'border-top' property is used to create a horizontal line that separates content in CSS, often used for styling section headers.

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'typeof' operator?
options: To check if a variable is defined
To check the type of a variable
To assign a type to a variable
questions.answer: To check the type of a variable
questions.explanation: The 'typeof' operator is used in JavaScript to check the type of a variable and returns a string indicating the data type.

questions.question: Which HTTP status code indicates a successful request in web development?
questions.explanation: The HTTP status code '200' (OK) indicates a successful request in web development, meaning the server has successfully processed the request.

questions.question: Which JavaScript framework is often used for building single-page applications?
questions.explanation: React is a popular JavaScript framework used for building single-page applications (SPAs) and handling the view layer of web applications.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'action' attribute in an HTML form element?
options: To specify the form's encoding type
To indicate the URL to handle form data
questions.answer: To indicate the URL to handle form data
questions.explanation: The 'action' attribute in an HTML form element is used to specify the URL to which the form data should be submitted when the user clicks the submit button.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the order of flex items in a flex container?
questions.explanation: The 'order' property is used in CSS flexbox to change the order of flex items within a flex container. Items with lower values appear first.

questions.question: What does SQL stand for in web development?
questions.explanation: SQL stands for Structured Query Language, used for managing and querying databases in web development.
